body: Looking at the `[winit X11 error]` message this seems to come from winit. If you clone to https://github.com/tomaka/winit and run `cargo run --example window` do you get the same error?

Same here on Archlinux.
Output of alacritty-v is :
```
Welcome to Alacritty.
Configuration loaded from /home/tristan/.config/alacritty/alacritty.yml
device_pixel_ratio: inf
width: 1024, height: 768
Initializing glyph cache
Finished initializing glyph cache in 0.03183738
width: 84, height: 76
Cell Size: (1 x 3)
[winit X11 error] XError {
    description: "BadValue (integer parameter out of range for operation)",
    error_code: 2,
    request_code: 12,
    minor_code: 0
}
PTY Dimensions: Line(24) x Column(80)
thread 'main' panicked at 'Failed to lookup raw keysym: XError { description: "BadValue (integer parameter out of range for operation)", error_code: 2, request_code: 12, minor_code: 0 }', libcore/result.rs:945:5
note: Run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace.
```

Obviously the issue is `device_pixel_ratio: inf`... Worked before updating it to last version on AUR.

As for winit, I am unsure what it's supposed to look like but it's all kind of fucked-up right now. Basically the window is transparent and shows a bugged version of what's in its background.

Tagging @francesca64 the winit guru. It seems like this is a problem for winit? Might be a good idea to just open an issue with winit if that's true and then link it here.

If I understand @Tristan971 correctly he did test the winit examples and they were broken too, so that seems like the right approach to take. Alacritty recently just made a pretty big jump in winit versions I think, so this is probably a result of that.

The `device_pixel_ratio` is exactly the return value of `window.hidpi_factor()` as far as I know.

https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/blob/765949f256aefcc513d0bfb46b64d315f9c2f3d2/src/display.rs#L218-L219

Since the value is `inf`, I'd assume this has to do with division by 0? Since `hidpi_factor` returns a floating point value it should be `+inf` whenever the numerator is positive and the denominator is 0.0. I'm not quite sure how it's calculated internally in winit though, it seems like this is the correct place where it's calculated for X11:

https://github.com/tomaka/winit/blob/30f798b24608aaee9b727f40fb051ad66f445920/src/platform/linux/x11/monitor.rs#L69

This makes it look like it's not actually calculated in winit itself but just retrieved from the X.Org connection. Which would lead me to believe that X.Org is reporting this pixel ratio directly as infinity? I'm not entirely sure if any of this is correct, but that's what I'm getting out of this.

The math (along with `get_output_info`'s implementation) is right here: https://github.com/tomaka/winit/blob/30f798b24608aaee9b727f40fb051ad66f445920/src/platform/linux/x11/util/randr.rs#L52.

All `xconn` methods are defined in winit (99% of them are in `util`).
Oh okay, this would lead me to believe that either `width_mm` or  `height_mm` is reported as 0.

Agree with that, fine with me opening a PR to add it? Even though it might be nice to get some confirmation from @Woolworths or @Tristan971 that this is actually the issue.

If anyone of you would be ready to test a PR, please let me know and I'll ping you once I've got something working.
Yeah, go ahead. You'll be the first person to have any blame in the `util` module other than me.
I'm not sure if I'll be able to deal with that responsibility. :D

Hello @chrisduerr and @francesca64 this happens on work computer so I'll be checking that tomorrow !
Thanks for the prompt answers in any case 😄👍
